params.text:
VARIETAL AND SITE SELECTION

Selecting a quality planting material is the key to successful production by planting a variety or cultivar as recommended by reliable seed companies and the National Seed Industry Council (NSIC) would be of great help. Prior planting, the characteristics of the variety are considered that fits with the existing conditions of the area are considered. Some adjustments are also to be made so as not to affect the productivity of the crop, hence, still economical. Chemical and physical properties of the soil and favorable socio-economic conditions are likewise considered for reasonable production.

 

Criteria in the selection of varieties

 Adaptability, maturity, yield, resistance or tolerance to pests, and market or consumer demand should be considered in selecting the variety of pole sitao to be planted.  Given below are the NSIC registered varieties of pole sitao.

params.text:
Site Selection

Pole sitao is well adapted to and best grows in warm climate, under full sunlight, and with a temperature range of 20-35 °C. While it can tolerate partial shading and any type of soil, it prefers   in a friable fertile soil with pH of 5.5-6.8. High pod percentage is achieved during wet season (WS) and the dry season (DS) particularly during the months of May, October and November, respectively.
